Scott Stringer Launches Campaign for New York City Mayor  Promising to tackle corruption in city government, restore the promise of New York, and deliver results. Vision. Experience. Competence. NEW YORK, NEW YORK â€“ Today, Scott Stringer, a proven reformer, lifelong New Yorker, and Democrat, officially announced his campaign for mayor of New York City. With a focus on ending corruption, restoring trust and competence in government, and delivering results for New Yorkers, Stringer pledged to turn the page on the culture of dysfunction that has plagued City Hall during the Adams administration. â€œNew York City is at a crossroads, but itâ€™s not that we're without solutionsâ€”we're without leadership,â€ said Stringer. â€œOver three years of disarray and pay-to-play politics at City Hall have left families priced out of their homes, neighborhoods feeling unsafe, and schools failing our children. New Yorkers are frustrated, and the very foundation of our cityâ€”its great promise of opportunity and fairnessâ€”has been eroded at the hands of corruption.â€ â€œBut Iâ€™m confident it will take just one election to turn this around,â€ continued Stringer. â€œIâ€™m running to deliver the vision, competent leadership, and bold reforms our city desperately needs. From ethics reform to public safety to housing to education, we need a mayor who will put people over politics and get things done for New Yorkers. I've spent my career reforming broken institutions and delivering for New Yorkers across the city and state. That's exactly what I'll do as mayor.â€ As a former New York City Comptroller, Manhattan Borough President, and State Assemblymember, Stringer has spent decades reforming city institutions to ensure they serve all New Yorkers, not just cronies and the well-connected. His successful track record when taking on tough fightsâ€”including rooting out corruption, auditing city agencies, and delivering common-sense policies that improve the lives of New York familiesâ€”shows that he has the ability and skillset to get results as mayor. â€œI've transformed every office I've held,â€ Stringer said. â€œI know where the problems are at City Hall and I know exactly how to start fixing them. This isn't the moment for more empty promises, platitudes, or on-the-job training. New York needs someone ready to restore competent government from day one.â€ Beyond cleaning up City Hall, Stringer hits the campaign trail with an ambitious agenda focused on New York's most pressing challenges: improving public safety and quality of life, building housing and increasing affordability, cleaning up our streets, bolstering education and support for children, and ensuring the city gets to work for its people. â€œAs a father raising children in this city, I know firsthand the challenges families face, and Iâ€™ve watched the basic functioning of our city paralyzed by corruption and mismanagement,â€ Stringer added. â€œWhen schools aren't working, when public spaces feel unsafe, when housing is unaffordable, people leave. New Yorkers simply arenâ€™t getting their end of the bargainâ€”and that is why I cannot stay on the sidelines any longer. I'm running to make sure every family can build a future here and people can proudly call New York home.â€ The announcement marks Stringer's return to public service after three years out of elected office, giving him the perspective of both an insider who knows how to make government work and an outsider who, like so many other New Yorkers, is fed up with the failures of the current administration. The Reformer New York Needs As a two-time citywide elected official, Scott knows how to build winning coalitions, and he has the practical skills to help New Yorkers struggling with soaring housing costs, streets and subways feeling unsafe, and broken trust in their leaders. Under Adams, City Hall has become a revolving door for scandal and self-interest. As Adams aligns himself with Donald Trump in search of a federal pardon, New Yorkers are left questioning whether their mayor is working for them or prioritizing his personal interests. Stringer offers a stark contrast: a steady hand with over 30 years of proven reform experience. While Adams courts controversy and chaos, Stringer has built his career on rooting out corruption, restoring transparency and competence to government, and putting the needs of everyday New Yorkers first. â€œThis is a moment for real leadership, not backroom deals and drama,â€ Stringer said. â€œNew Yorkers deserve a mayor who fights for them, not for his political survival and self-interest.â€ Stringerâ€™s vision for restoring the promise of this great city is built on delivering tangible results, such as affordable housing, well-maintained streets, safe neighborhoods and subways, and a government that works for all. Tackling Corruption and Cleaning Up City Hall The corruption at City Hall isnâ€™t merely a crisis; itâ€™s a betrayal of the people and values that built this city. Federal investigations have investigated illegal foreign donations, bribery schemes, and kickbacks in public contractsâ€”all while the urgent needs of everyday New Yorkers are ignored. Thatâ€™s why Stringer launched his campaign with a comprehensive Ethics and Anti-Corruption Agenda designed to eliminate pay-to-play practices, increase transparency, and hold city officials accountable. The plan includes banning contributions from lobbyists and contractors, closing loopholes that allow undue influence, and implementing unprecedented levels of public disclosureâ€‹. As mayor, Stringer will implement gold-standard ethics rules and be a fearless champion of good government, as he has throughout his 30-year career in public service. As Manhattan Borough President, Stringer replaced patronage with merit and gave communities a real voiceâ€”strengthening and reforming community board systems. As New York City Comptroller, he exposed fraud, audited wasteful contracts, and held bad actors accountable. As a New York State Assemblymember, Stringer ended the corrupt practice of empty-seat voting and rooted out the culture of backroom politics in Albany. â€œWhen City Hallâ€™s decisions are chaotic and corrupt, families lose their homes, schools remain overcrowded, and subways continue to crumble,â€ Stringer said. â€œThis isnâ€™t just mismanagement, itâ€™s a collapse of public trust. Every decision and appointment my administration makes will be focused on whatâ€™s best for New Yorkersâ€”nothing more, nothing less. Thatâ€™s the standard, and itâ€™s what I have represented in every public office I have held.â€ The Ethics Agenda also introduces new measures to strengthen oversight and ensure long-term accountability in city governance. Stringerâ€™s proposals include creating an independent compliance unit to monitor and enforce campaign finance rules, mandating financial disclosures from all candidates for city office, and instituting a permanent ban on contractors who violate campaign finance laws. â€œEvery backroom deal robs our communities of affordable housing and constricts resources from fixing the subways, improving public safety, or upgrading schools,â€ Stringer said. â€œThe dysfunction and corruption stops with me. Itâ€™s time to clean up the mess and put New Yorkersâ€”not the powerful fewâ€”back to the center of city government.â€ Restoring the Promise of New York Stringerâ€™s platform reflects his vision to restore the broken compact between New Yorkers and their governmentâ€”a compact that ensures affordable housing, safety, high-quality education, and functioning public services like transit. â€œFor generations, New York City was a place where families came to build better livesâ€”a city of opportunity, driven by a compact between the city and its people: work hard, and the city will have your back. But today, that promise is either broken or slipping away through neglect and mismanagement. It's time to restore our compact,â€ Stringer said. Stringerâ€™s housing plan is the culmination of a lifetime of advocating for affordable housing, notably serving as an organizer to protect and advocate for the rights of Mitchell-Lama residents, an affordable homeownership model that Stringer hopes to emulate when he is mayor. â€œIt is the duty of every mayor to build housing and be bold in the growth of our city, and thatâ€™s just not what the current administration has been focused on,â€ Stringer continued. â€œNew Yorkers deserve leadership that not only prioritizes affordability and access to housing but ensures that our city services, including safe and clean streets and world-class education, are the keystone for thriving communities. This isnâ€™t just about good governance, itâ€™s about the city holding up its end of the bargain for New Yorkers who sacrifice so much just to live here and go above and beyond to make our communities so strong.â€ Stringer also outlined key priorities for his administration, the full details of which are available here. Highlights include: Housing Affordability: Stringer envisions his plan as Mitchell-Lama 2.0â€”a bold yet practical strategy that builds on the historic success of the original program to tackle New York Cityâ€™s housing crisis. With four transformative pillars, this plan reimagines affordable housing to deliver stability, opportunity, and dignity for all New Yorkers. Unlocking Public Land: Transforming underutilized city-owned properties, like DOT garages and vacant lots into affordable housing through fast-tracked audits and development. Robin Hood Housing Plan: Reclaiming neglected properties from irresponsible landlords and converting them into affordable housing. Revolving Loan Fund: Establishing a new $500 million fund to support MWBE and nonprofit developers in creating community-focused housing. Revitalizing Public Housing: Securing $40 billion for critical NYCHA repairs and modernization, ensuring safe, livable homes for over 400,000 residents. â€œWhen the options for housing are a $2 million condo or a shelter, something is fundamentally broken,â€ Stringer said about his housing priorities. â€œIâ€™ll never forget the single mom in Washington Heights who told me she was terrified of losing her home after her landlord raised the rent overnight. Fighting for families like hers is why I started this journey and why Iâ€™m running today.â€ Public Safety and Quality of Life: Stringer knows that everything else is secondary until we get public safety and quality of life right. Heâ€™s committed to ensuring no New York is worried when getting on the subway, sitting in the park, or walking down the street: Rebuilding and Refocusing Police Capacity: Bold recruitment efforts and innovative retention policies to address NYPD staffing shortages, including hiring 3,000 more officers, and â€œcivilianizingâ€ NYPD administrative roles to free up uniformed officers for core policing duties. Leveraging Technology for Smarter Policing: Integrating advanced analytics, expanded monitoring, and transparent oversight to enable the NYPD to move from reactive policing to a proactive, multi-agency approach. A Unified Approach to Public Safety and Quality of Life: Launching QualitySTAT, a performance management tool designed to align resources, streamline decision-making, and strengthen accountability across all key agencies; under a new Deputy Mayor for Quality of Life, this integrated system will address crime, quality-of-life issues, and systemic inefficiencies, creating a safer, more cohesive city. Transit Safety: A dedicated officer on every subway train, ethical data-driven monitoring, and compassionate crisis response by mental-health and other social services professionals. â€œNew Yorkers should be able to send their kids to school, hang out in the park, and walk down the street without ever feeling unsafe," said Stringer about the pressing need for public safety solutions. â€œNew Yorkers deserve both safe streets and accountable policing. This isn't an either/or choice. Public safety isnâ€™t about winning the headlines or using excuses to cover up mistakes. Itâ€™s about management and delivering results that people can see and feel in their neighborhoods every day.â€ Supporting Families Through Affordable Childcare and Education: Stringer is determined to make childcare affordable for and responsive to the needs of all families, ensuring New York City a place where every parent and child has the support they need to thrive. Stringerâ€™s plan includes three transformative solutions: Affordable Childcare for All Families: The Tri-Share Childcare Fund will split childcare costs between the city, employers, and families to ensure no parent is priced out of care. Extended School Hours: Extending school hours to 4:30 PM to provide free or low-cost afterschool programs, better aligning with parentsâ€™ work schedules and offering enrichment opportunities for children. Reducing Costs for Families: Scott's plan will reduce childcare costs significantlyâ€”by more than 50 percent for many familiesâ€”expand access to licensed care in underserved neighborhoods, and align school schedules with the realities of todayâ€™s families. â€œI spoke with a mother in Queens who works two jobs just to keep her family afloat. She told me her biggest challenge isnâ€™t the hours she worksâ€”itâ€™s finding affordable childcare for her son. Sheâ€™s not alone,â€ said Stringer . â€œThousands of parents across our city are forced to make impossible choices every day. Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m running for mayorâ€”to make sure no parent has to choose between their job and their childâ€™s future.â€ Sanitation: Scott Stringer will start picking up the trash. His comprehensive sanitation plan will transform New York Cityâ€™s waste management system into a cleaner, more efficient, and sustainable operation. His plan will: Reduce Sidewalk Clutter: Prioritize shared on-street containers and innovative waste storage solutions tailored to each neighborhood. Boost Recycling and Composting: Fully integrate recycling and composting into the waste system with clear, color-coded bins and public education campaigns. Improve Efficiency: Modernize waste collection with advanced technologies, upgraded recycling facilities, and local processing plants to reduce landfill dependency. Build for the Future: Mandate waste management infrastructure in new developments, including recycling chutes and compactors, to support long-term sustainability. Scottâ€™s plan prioritizes clean streets, public health, and environmental responsibility, delivering real results for every New Yorker. A Proven Record of Accountability and Results Stringer has spent over 30 years building a record of reform, accountability, and results for New Yorkers. In every role heâ€™s held, Stringer has reformed government to work better for the people it serves. As New York City Comptroller, he exposed billions of dollars in waste and mismanagement across city agencies. Stringerâ€™s reform-minded approach to uncovering corruption ensured that public funds were directed where they were needed most, from repairing NYCHA developments to improving public transit. One of Stringerâ€™s key priorities as Comptroller was ensuring that public funds were spent wisely and transparently. By reforming how city contracts were awarded, he exposed delays, malfeasance, and waste in procurement processes that left critical services in limbo. His leadership saved taxpayers billions while demanding greater efficiency and transparency from city agencies. As Manhattan Borough President, Stringer redefined what the office could achieve. He transformed community boards into engines of local democracy, empowering neighborhoods to have a real voice in shaping their future. Scott championed affordable housing by advocating for the Mitchell-Lama program and securing funding for developments that working families could afford. His forward-thinking urban policy initiatives, from food justice to zoning reform, earned him recognition as a leader who could turn bold ideas into results. Stringerâ€™s career as an elected official began in the New York State Assembly, where he stood up to entrenched interests and ended the corrupt practice of empty-seat voting. He championed tenantsâ€™ rights, fought for hardworking families, and laid the foundation for his career-long commitment to making government work for everyday people. At every stage of his career, Stringer has delivered results that matter. From exposing fraud, saving taxpayer dollars, to creating opportunities for New Yorkâ€™s families, Stringerâ€™s record speaks for itself. His proven ability to reform broken systems and deliver for New Yorkers is exactly what the city needs now to rebuild trust, restore competence, and move forward. About Scott Stringer Scott Stringer is a lifelong New Yorker born and raised in Washington Heights. Scott's three decades of public service are defined by his love for New York City and Scott has a proven track record as a reformer who knows how to make government work for people. As a State Assemblymember, he fearlessly took on the political establishment, ended the corrupt practice of empty-seat voting, and championed the rights of tenants and hardworking New York families. As Manhattan Borough President, Scott revolutionized what the office could achieve. He didn't just write reports; he wrote a playbook for urban policy, issuing over 40 groundbreaking studies that tackled everything from affordable housing to food justice. When others saw community boards as relics, Scott saw them as engines of democracy, reforming and empowering them to give neighborhoods a real say in their future. Then, as New York City Comptroller, Scott emerged as New York's fiercest watchdog. He fearlessly exposed waste and corruption while protecting billions in taxpayer dollars. His innovative Boardroom Accountability Project became a national model for corporate reform, proving that good government and fiscal responsibility go hand in hand. But for Scott, this isn't just politics; it's personal. He and his wife Elyse are raising their two sons, Max and Miles, in the city they love. Like countless New Yorkers, he feels the weight of a city thatâ€™s not meeting the needs of its people: rising costs, failing services, and a city government that too often forgets who it's supposed to serve. Every subway ride to school and every walk through their neighborhood reinforces the urgency to fix whatâ€™s broken. That's why Scott has returned to the political arena with a bold vision to restore competent leadership to City Hall. Drawing on his unparalleled experience and unwavering values, he's ready to rebuild the compact between New York and its people: work hard, and the city will have your back. In Scott's 30 years of public service, he's never lost faith in the promise of New York. Now, at this crucial moment, he's offering not just his experience but his heartâ€”the heart of a true New Yorker who knows that our city's greatest chapters are still to be written.
